text: Hi Halima. Sorry to hear you were sick after your trip! That's a shame.

I'm really impressed by the information youve given about yourself. I love the subjects you're studying - I'm a big art person myself, I like to spend most of my time in galleries and educating myself with new literature and creative stuff. I love living in London because it's so easy to get that cultural aspect.
Its so important to have hobbies, so it's great to hear you do photography. Any favourite photographers? I'm not so good on photography!
Do you think you want to study architecture at University? It's a very good degree and I know most people enjoy it. It often takes about 7 years to complete, though- worth bearing in mind.

A bit about myself : Im 25 and I work in London in the social enterprise sector. I help social businesses to grow their ideas and to increase their impact. They are trying to do good for society through their businesses. It's great and I love it. 
I studied French and Politics at Aston University and I grew up in Bournemouth. I moved straight to London after uni and went into the charity sector.
I love music, gigs, art, travelling and also my dog :)
I did French, politics and business for my a-levels
Would love to hear more about your thoughts for uni - if that's what you want to do.

Hey Camilla, 
I’m feeling much better now :) how are you?

I have started writing my personal statement for architecture and have researched into how long it will take to become a qualified architect. 
I’m not too worried about the 7 years because after completing my 3 years I can use my highly transferable skills in other design-related disciplines :slightly_smiling_face: (if architecture isn’t the route I’m looking for when I’m done with uni) 

I haven’t got any favourite photographer(s), however I do get inspiration from Instagram photography pages and other artists. 

Your occupation is very interesting, I love learning about new careers because it gives me more options to look into for the future! And it’s great that you love it, I would hate to have a job that doesn’t interest me. 

At the moment I’m seeking help for my personal statement, I haven’t got any work experience or things related to architecture :confused: So far I’ve only managed to write about how my subjects have given me certain skills that might aid me for the university course
Hi Halima. I'm really well thanks - enjoying the sunny day.
That's great, sounds like you've really looking into things.

You're right - i have several friends who did their first 3 years in architecture. They then went on to do compeltely different things - on is doing a course in sustainable planning. It's such an interesting field.
Where do you want to study?
I'm really happy to look at your personal statement if that helps?
I also love instagram photography. I have an account for my dog :sweat_smile:

I think I’ll stay in London for uni, so far I’ve looked at the following universities:
University College London 
University of Greenwich 
University of Westminster 
Kingston university 
Regents university 

They all depend on what sort of grades I get so I’m keeping my options open — just in case. Although I would love to get into UCL or University of Greenwich, I’ve read some good reviews about this course (architecture) at these unis. However if my grades aren’t sufficient I’ll need to do more research about the other universities and narrow myself down to the good ones

I attended an open day at UCL, it was okay but I didn’t learn much from the presentation (most of the information was exactly like the info on their website so..) didn’t have enough time to stay for a tour, unfortunately.
I’ve booked one for University of Greenwich in October, I’ll see how that goes :slightly_smiling_face:
After polishing my personal statement, I shall send you it in the following weeks :slightly_smiling_face: thank you!
Haha, I follow a lot of dog pages on instagram my favourite are corgis and Samoyed dogs — my new fav
